assignment.name: Deny-Priv-Esc-AKS
assignment.displayName: Kubernetes clusters should not allow container privilege escalation
assignment.description: Do not allow containers to run with privilege escalation to root in a Kubernetes cluster. This recommendation is part of CIS 5.2.5 which is intended to improve the security of your Kubernetes environments. This policy is generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and preview for AKS Engine and Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more information, see https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc.

assignment.name: Deny-Privileged-AKS
assignment.displayName: Kubernetes cluster should not allow privileged containers
assignment.description: Do not allow privileged containers creation in a Kubernetes cluster. This recommendation is part of CIS 5.2.1 which is intended to improve the security of your Kubernetes environments. This policy is generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and preview for AKS Engine and Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more information, see https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc.

assignment.name: Enforce-AKS-HTTPS
assignment.displayName: Kubernetes clusters should be accessible only over HTTPS
assignment.description: Use of HTTPS ensures authentication and protects data in transit from network layer eavesdropping attacks. This capability is currently generally available for Kubernetes Service (AKS), and in preview for AKS Engine and Azure Arc enabled Kubernetes. For more info, visit https://aka.ms/kubepolicydoc

assignment.name: Deploy-AKS-Policy
assignment.displayName: Deploy Azure Policy Add-on to Azure Kubernetes Service clusters
assignment.description: Use Azure Policy Add-on to manage and report on the compliance state of your Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) clusters. For more information, see https://aka.ms/akspolicydoc.

assignment.name: Deny-IP-forwarding
assignment.displayName: Network interfaces should disable IP forwarding
assignment.description: This policy denies the network interfaces which enabled IP forwarding. The setting of IP forwarding disables Azure's check of the source and destination for a network interface. This should be reviewed by the network security team.

assignment.name: Deny-Subnet-Without-Nsg
assignment.displayName: Subnets should have a Network Security Group
assignment.description: This policy denies the creation of a subnet without a Network Security Group to protect traffic across subnets.

assignment.name: Deny-RDP-From-Internet
assignment.displayName: RDP access from the Internet should be blocked
assignment.description: This policy denies any network security rule that allows RDP access from Internet.

assignment.name: Enable-DDoS-VNET-lzones
assignment.displayName: Virtual networks should be protected by Azure DDoS Protection Standard
assignment.description: Protect your virtual networks against volumetric and protocol attacks with Azure DDoS Protection Standard. For more information, visit https://aka.ms/ddosprotectiondocs.

assignment.name: Deny-Storage-http
assignment.displayName: Secure transfer to storage accounts should be enabled
assignment.description: Audit requirement of Secure transfer in your storage account. Secure transfer is an option that forces your storage account to accept requests only from secure connections (HTTPS). Use of HTTPS ensures authentication between the server and the service and protects data in transit from network layer attacks such as man-in-the-middle, eavesdropping, and session-hijacking

assignment.name: Deploy-SQL-DB-Auditing
assignment.displayName: Auditing on SQL server should be enabled
assignment.description: Auditing on your SQL Server should be enabled to track database activities across all databases on the server and save them in an audit log.

assignment.name: Deploy-VM-Backup-LZ
assignment.displayName: Configure backup on virtual machines without a given tag to a new recovery services vault with a default policy
assignment.description: Enforce backup for all virtual machines by deploying a recovery services vault in the same location and resource group as the virtual machine. Doing this is useful when different application teams in your organization are allocated separate resource groups and need to manage their own backups and restores. You can optionally exclude virtual machines containing a specified tag to control the scope of assignment. See https://aka.ms/AzureVMAppCentricBackupExcludeTag.

assignment.name: Enforce-TLS-SSL
assignment.displayName: Deny or Deploy and append TLS requirements and SSL enforcement on resources without Encryption in transit
assignment.description: Choose either Deploy if not exist and append in combination with audit or Select Deny in the Policy effect. Deny polices shift left. Deploy if not exist and append enforce but can be changed, and because missing exsistense condition require then the combination of Audit.

assignment.name: Deploy-SQL-Threat
assignment.displayName: Deploy Threat Detection on SQL servers
assignment.description: This policy ensures that Threat Detection is enabled on SQL Servers.
